title: India Signs Five-Year Rice Pact with WFP - GK Today
description: India and the United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) have inked a five-year agreement, ensuring an annual supply of 200,000 tonnes of rice to combat global h
content:
1. India Signs Five-Year Rice Pact with WFP  GK Today
  2. India Strengthens Global Food Security: FCI Signs Five-Year Rice Supply Agreement with World Food Programme  PIB
  3. FCI Signs MoU with WFP to Supply 2 Lakh Metric Tonnes of Rice for Global Hunger Relief  News On AIR
  4. India To Supply 200,000 MT Rice To WFP Under Five-Year Agreement To Support Global Food Security  Swarajyamag
  5. FCI to supply 200,000 tonnes of rice to World Food Programme  BusinessLine

Background:

The United Nations World Food Programme (WFP) has signed a five-year agreement with the Indian Food Corporation Limited (FCI) and the Government of India, aiming to supply 200,000 metric tonnes of rice annually. This pact underscores a commitment to global food security by ensuring an uninterrupted provision of essential nutrients for millions worldwide.

Key Developments:

This agreement marks a significant step in enhancing WFP's capacity to combat hunger globally. The United Nations' mission is pivotal in addressing malnutrition and providing relief during times of crisis, making India’s contribution crucial. By securing this supply through FCI, the country demonstrates its role as a contributor to global food security.

Industry Impact:

The signed agreement has far-reaching implications for both WFP and Indian agriculture. It ensures that millions of people around the world can access much-needed rice supplies, contributing to their nutritional health and overall well-being. This collaboration reflects India's dedication towards meeting global challenges in ensuring sustainable development and eradicating hunger.

Expert Perspective:

Experts within the field of food security underscore the importance of such international partnerships aimed at alleviating global hunger. The agreement provides a concrete example where nations collaborate effectively to tackle complex issues, demonstrating how small steps can lead to significant impacts on broader societal health and welfare.

What This Means:

This partnership is likely to be pivotal in sustaining WFP’s operations, particularly during periods of increased need or resource constraints elsewhere in the world. It ensures that essential supplies continue uninterrupted, bolstering efforts towards global food security. The outcomes are expected to not only benefit millions within India but also contribute significantly to reducing hunger globally.

Looking Ahead:

As the agreement comes into effect, it is hoped that similar collaborations between WFP and Indian entities will pave the way for more impactful interventions in addressing global hunger. This collaboration highlights a vital aspect of international cooperation—whereby nations can collectively contribute to solving complex issues affecting billions worldwide.

The signing of this agreement signifies a renewed commitment towards ensuring food security not only within India but globally, making it an important milestone in sustainable development efforts.
